attributes.action: All new roofs including on old houses should be fitted with solar panels by law
attributes.additional_details: The Energy Saving Trust (EST) estimates that a typical three-bedroom home in the UK will use just over 3,000kw per year. So, a 4kw or 5kw system would cover this.
attributes.background: There is a target to build 200,000 homes each year, a 4-5kw system would provide enough energy to power a 3 bedroom house. Making it self reliant for power. There are to be 6551 in Cranbrook in Devon. This could produce 21618300 kw per year, rather than just consuming this amount.
